Hello, my name is...

Peter Do.

Former Environmental Engineer. Current Web Developer.

01. About Me

Hi! My name is Peter Do (pronounced "Doh!" like Homer Simpson) and I am an aspiring full stack web developer based in Toronto, Ontario. My interest in web development started back in high school when I would customize my Tumblr and MySpace pages. Little did I know I was using HTML/CSS to do so!

After high school, I obtained my degree in environmental engineering and spent 5 years in the industry, earning my P.Eng. designation. Ultimately, I decided to switch careers and dive back into the world of web development! I am currently completing the Full Stack Web Development curriculum at The Odin Project. I hope to complete it in the near future and join the world of professional web development.

Outside of web development, I am an avid disc golfer and enjoy the outdoors as much as I can. I also enjoy playing video games on my PC, getting together with friends, and playing music!

02. Projects

Battleship

Javascript/HTML/CSS web application of the classic game Battleship versus AI. This was The Odin Project's capstone vanilla Javascript project.

To-Do-List

Basic To-Do-List web application using HTML/CSS, Javascript, ES6 modules, and webpack. The To-Do-List can add, remove, and edit projects and tasks.

Weather App

Basic weather web application using HTML/CSS, Javascript, and weatherAPI. Application provides real-time weather data for searched location.

Book Library

Simple book library web application using HTML/CSS and Javascript. Book Library allows users to add and remove books onto local storage and keep track of read status.

Calculator

Simple calculator web application using HTML/CSS and Javascript. Your everyday calculator! Yes, the style was heavily inspired by the iPhone calculator app.

Etch-A-Sketch

Fun Etch-A-Sketch web application using HTML/CSS and Javascript. The Etch-A-Sketch allows user to set the grid size and randomize the colors.

03. Contact

Get In Touch

I am still learning, but my inbox is always open! If you have a questions or just want to say hi, I will do my best to get back to you!
